oai_dc:dc.dc:title: GLOBAL-SOLUTIONS DESCRIBING THE COLLAPSE OF A SPHERICAL OR CYLINDRICAL CAVITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SACHDEV, PL
GUPTA, N
AHLUWALIA, DS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The collapse of a spherical (cylindrical) cavity in air is studied analytically. The global solution for the entire domain between the sound front, separating the undisturbed and the disturbed gas, and the vacuum front is constructed in the form of infinite series in time with coefficients depending on an 'appropriate' similarity variable. At time t = 0+. the exact planar solution for a uniformly moving cavity is assumed to hold. The global analytic solution of this initial boundary value problem is found until the collapse time (=(gamma - 1)/2) for gamma less-than-or-equal-to 1 + (2/(1 + nu)), where nu = 1 for cylindrical geometry, and nu = 2 for spherical geometry. For higher values of gamma, the solution series diverge at time t = 2(beta - 1)/(nu(1 + beta) + (1 - beta)2) where 2/(gamma - 1). A close agreement is found in the prediction of qualitative features of analytic solution and numerical results of Thomas et al. [1].
